data: 1 00:00:09,276 --> 00:00:11,679 (AUDIENCE CHEERING AND APPLAUDING FAINTLY) 2 00:00:16,116 --> 00:00:18,452 AUDIENCE: (CHANTING) Horsemen! Horsemen! 3 00:00:18,520 --> 00:00:22,055 Horsemen! Horsemen! Horsemen! 4 00:00:22,122 --> 00:00:26,961 Horsemen! Horsemen! Horsemen! Horsemen! 5 00:00:28,395 --> 00:00:30,030 ATLAS: Did you think we abandoned you? 6 00:00:30,097 --> 00:00:31,900 (AUDIENCE CHEERING LOUDLY) 7 00:00:34,936 --> 00:00:37,037 Or that we'd run out of magic? 8 00:00:38,606 --> 00:00:40,040 Well, think again, ladies and gentlemen, 9 00:00:40,107 --> 00:00:42,109 because you are about to be amazed. 10 00:00:42,175 --> 00:00:45,112 (AUDIENCE CHEERING LOUDLY) 11 00:00:45,178 --> 00:00:47,214 If you're here right now, then you have 12 00:00:47,281 --> 00:00:49,049 followed the clues and cracked the code. 13 00:00:50,985 --> 00:00:52,820 Congratulations, and welcome. 14 00:00:52,887 --> 00:00:55,957 (INTRIGUING MUSIC PLAYING) 15 00:00:56,024 --> 00:00:58,425 It's been 10 years since the horseman last appeared, 16 00:00:59,393 --> 00:01:00,962 but we are back! 17 00:01:01,029 --> 00:01:02,997 (AUDIENCE CHEERING LOUDLY) 18 00:01:04,666 --> 00:01:08,002 Okay, so, come in close. Mm, closer. 19 00:01:08,068 --> 00:01:09,771 Because the more you think you see, 20 00:01:09,837 --> 00:01:12,072 the easier it will be to dress up old tricks 21 00:01:12,139 --> 00:01:13,741 and fool you that they are new. 22 00:01:13,808 --> 00:01:15,944 (AUDIENCE CHEERING LOUDLY) 23 00:01:16,010 --> 00:01:17,912 So, my name is J. Daniel Atlas, 24 00:01:17,979 --> 00:01:19,948 and allow me to speak as I often do 25 00:01:20,014 --> 00:01:22,650 for my less charismatic colleagues when I say... 26 00:01:22,717 --> 00:01:24,752 Whoo! It is very good to be back! 27 00:01:24,819 --> 00:01:26,788 (AUDIENCE CHEERING LOUDLY) 28 00:01:29,356 --> 00:01:30,992 Yes. Yes. We vanished for a while, 29 00:01:31,059 --> 00:01:32,259 but in the world of magic, 30 00:01:32,326 --> 00:01:34,862 everything that disappears, reappears. 31 00:01:34,929 --> 00:01:36,864 Well, at least if the trick is done right. 32 00:01:37,865 --> 00:01:39,867 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 33 00:01:41,069 --> 00:01:43,771 I'm Merritt McKinney. (CHUCKLES) 34 00:01:43,838 --> 00:01:47,174 Unlike my, uh, very good buddy here, Danny, 35 00:01:47,240 --> 00:01:51,178 most of you checked your egos at the door tonight. 36 00:01:51,244 --> 00:01:54,381 You found this little underground soiree 37 00:01:54,448 --> 00:01:57,217 because you wanted to get fooled. 38 00:01:57,284 --> 00:01:58,987 Hey, everyone. I'm Jack Wilder. 39 00:01:59,053 --> 00:02:00,888 (AUDIENCE CHEERING AND SHOUTING INDISTINCTLY) 40 00:02:02,690 --> 00:02:06,694 Wars, pandemics, climate change, AI. 41 00:02:06,761 --> 00:02:09,731 Let's face it, we all need magic more than ever. 42 00:02:11,131 --> 00:02:14,201 So I want you to pay very close attention. 43 00:02:14,267 --> 00:02:16,336 You are not gonna want to miss this next trick. 44 00:02:17,972 --> 00:02:19,907 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 45 00:02:21,075 --> 00:02:23,511 Henley Reeves, now Henley Reeves Stanley. 46 00:02:23,578 --> 00:02:26,581 Three kids, two dogs and a master's degree. 47 00:02:26,648 --> 00:02:27,915 It's been a while. 48 00:02:27,982 --> 00:02:29,182 Did you miss us? 49 00:02:29,249 --> 00:02:31,485 (AUDIENCE CHEERING LOUDLY) 50 00:02:33,121 --> 00:02:34,656 Those guys were great back in the day. 51 00:02:34,722 --> 00:02:36,557 I used to want to be a magician. 52 00:02:36,624 --> 00:02:39,060 -And then I turned 12. -(BOTH LAUGH) 53 00:02:39,127 --> 00:02:41,596 Careful, they might be listening. 54 00:02:41,663 --> 00:02:43,196 Ooh, I'm shaking in my AllSaints. 55 00:02:43,263 --> 00:02:45,432 What are they gonna do? (CHUCKLES) 56 00:02:45,499 --> 00:02:47,167 Is that real gold? 57 00:02:47,234 --> 00:02:49,269 -What? -Is that real gold? 58 00:02:49,336 --> 00:02:51,572 -Yeah, I'm rich. -(SNORTS) 59 00:02:51,639 --> 00:02:53,708 This is a magic show, dude. 60 00:02:53,775 --> 00:02:55,710 Every fool here is a pickpocket, 61 00:02:55,777 --> 00:02:57,011 or a pickpocket's fool. 62 00:02:57,078 --> 00:02:58,546 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 63 00:02:59,947 --> 00:03:01,849 -Was that a haiku? -What was that? 64 00:03:01,916 --> 00:03:03,417 Each of you just received a playing card. 65 00:03:03,483 --> 00:03:06,353 If you wouldn't mind, uh, pulling it out? 66 00:03:06,420 --> 00:03:08,255 Right. Now, we're gonna shuffle the deck, 67 00:03:08,321 --> 00:03:10,792 so everybody find a random person near them 68 00:03:10,858 --> 00:03:12,927 and switch cards with them. 69 00:03:12,994 --> 00:03:14,128 And then when you've done that, 70 00:03:14,194 --> 00:03:16,864 find somebody else and switch with them. 71 00:03:16,931 --> 00:03:18,566 Okay, great. Uh, now... 72 00:03:18,633 --> 00:03:20,601 Uh, duh-duh-duh-duh-duh... You there, down there. 73 00:03:20,668 --> 00:03:22,369 -Me? -Yeah. What is your card? 74 00:03:22,436 --> 00:03:24,806 -Ace of diamonds. -Ace of diamonds. Okay. 75 00:03:24,872 --> 00:03:26,641 Let's make things a little more complicated here. 76 00:03:26,708 --> 00:03:29,744 Does anybody else here have the ace of diamonds? 77 00:03:29,811 --> 00:03:31,612 Wait, it's me. Ace of diamonds! 78 00:03:31,679 --> 00:03:33,280 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 79 00:03:33,346 --> 00:03:34,716 MERRITT: Ooh! 80 00:03:34,782 --> 00:03:38,119 Looks like we have a Fifth Horseman not named Lula. 81 00:03:38,186 --> 00:03:40,788 Come up on stage, you're gonna be our helper. 82 00:03:40,855 --> 00:03:42,857 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 83 00:03:44,058 --> 00:03:46,226 MAN 1: Do it! MAN 2: Yeah, go! 84 00:03:51,465 --> 00:03:54,669 Now, uh, look into my eyes 85 00:03:54,736 --> 00:03:57,404 and... sleep. (SNAPS FINGERS) 86 00:03:57,471 --> 00:04:00,174 -(AUDIENCE GASPS) -(CHUCKLES) Still got it. 87 00:04:00,240 --> 00:04:02,643 Now, this might look like an ordinary kid to you, 88 00:04:02,710 --> 00:04:06,647 but tonight, he is going to do extraordinary magic 89 00:04:06,714 --> 00:04:09,117 like a man possessed. 90 00:04:09,183 --> 00:04:10,417 -Literally. -(AUDIENCE EXCLAIMING) 91 00:04:10,484 --> 00:04:12,419 -Henley. -Yes, Merritt. 92 00:04:12,486 --> 00:04:15,923 Would you mind stepping inside his body? 93 00:04:15,990 --> 00:04:17,692 -(SNAPS FINGERS) -(AUDIENCE GASPS) 94 00:04:17,759 --> 00:04:21,361 Yep. And, Jack, uh, why don't you throw yourself on in there, too? 95 00:04:21,428 --> 00:04:23,097 -What I do best. -(SNAPS FINGERS) 96 00:04:23,164 --> 00:04:26,466 -(AUDIENCE GASPS) -And... Oh, God help you. 97 00:04:26,534 --> 00:04:29,469 Atlas, why don't you slither on inside, as well? 98 00:04:31,105 --> 00:04:32,372 -(SNAPS FINGERS) -(AUDIENCE GASPS) 99 00:04:32,439 --> 00:04:35,176 And I might as well wedge myself in there, too. 100 00:04:35,243 --> 00:04:37,812 It takes a village to make magic. 101 00:04:37,879 --> 00:04:39,881 -(SNAPS FINGERS) -(AUDIENCE EXCLAIMING) 102 00:04:43,918 --> 00:04:45,553 MAN IN AUDIENCE: Oh! WOMAN: Whoa! 103 00:04:45,620 --> 00:04:47,320 (AS ATLAS) J. Daniel Atlas in the house. 104 00:04:47,387 --> 00:04:49,322 So, who wants to see a magic trick? 105 00:04:49,389 --> 00:04:51,092 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 106 00:04:54,294 --> 00:04:55,462 Take it away, Merritt. 107 00:04:56,631 --> 00:04:57,832 (AUDIENCE EXCLAIMING) 108 00:04:57,899 --> 00:05:00,568 (AS MERRITT) Hello, you beautiful people. 109 00:05:00,635 --> 00:05:03,871 Now, everyone knows that Merritt McKinney reads minds. 110 00:05:03,938 --> 00:05:08,075 Well, now, I'm him. Or he's me. Who knows? 111 00:05:08,142 --> 00:05:09,342 (AUDIENCE LAUGHS) 112 00:05:09,409 --> 00:05:13,247 Uh, I'm sensing someone came here tonight 113 00:05:13,313 --> 00:05:17,084 not to enjoy magic, but to tear it down. 114 00:05:17,151 --> 00:05:21,488 Is there a Brett Finnegan in the house? 115 00:05:21,556 --> 00:05:23,390 -BRETT: What up? -(AUDIENCE CHEERING) 116 00:05:23,456 --> 00:05:24,992 (BRETT'S FRIEND SPEAKING INDISTINCTLY) 117 00:05:26,761 --> 00:05:28,896 Now, you and your friends here 118 00:05:28,963 --> 00:05:32,099 set up the Camp Hobart Crypto Exchange. 119 00:05:32,166 --> 00:05:33,768 -Fact. Yep. Yeah. -It's what we're about. 120 00:05:33,835 --> 00:05:35,368 Took the good people of New York's 121 00:05:35,435 --> 00:05:38,405 employee pension and welfare fund half its cash. 122 00:05:38,471 --> 00:05:40,208 -(AUDIENCE BOOING) -Uh, you're rounding up, 123 00:05:40,274 --> 00:05:42,677 and also, the risks were laid out very clearly. 124 00:05:42,743 --> 00:05:44,545 Everybody knew what they were getting into, dude. 125 00:05:44,612 --> 00:05:46,848 Did you hide the profits offshore? 126 00:05:46,914 --> 00:05:53,888 Account ending in 53297? 127 00:05:53,955 --> 00:05:55,223 (CHUCKLES NERVOUSLY) 128 00:05:55,289 --> 00:05:57,058 You couldn't know that without my, uh... 129 00:05:58,659 --> 00:05:59,694 (AUDIENCE GASPS) 130 00:05:59,760 --> 00:06:01,095 (AS JACK) Oh, is this real gold? 131 00:06:01,162 --> 00:06:02,630 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 132 00:06:02,697 --> 00:06:05,432 Brett, you ought to be more careful with your things, man. 133 00:06:05,498 --> 00:06:07,535 Merritt's a psychic, but me, Jack, 134 00:06:07,602 --> 00:06:09,369 -I'm into sleight of hand. -(AUDIENCE EXCLAIMS) 135 00:06:09,436 --> 00:06:12,472 Ask your friends. They've just done their part to close the wealth gap. 136 00:06:12,540 --> 00:06:14,474 -(AUDIENCE CHEERING) -What? What the... 137 00:06:14,542 --> 00:06:17,410 Now, here's a little redistribution. 138 00:06:17,477 --> 00:06:18,913 Hey! Hey, hey! 139 00:06:18,980 --> 00:06:20,982 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 140 00:06:23,684 --> 00:06:24,852 Thank you. Thank you. 141 00:06:24,919 --> 00:06:26,153 Lawyer up, dude! I'll kick your ass! 142 00:06:26,220 --> 00:06:27,755 (AS HENLEY) Uh-oh! 143 00:06:27,822 --> 00:06:30,390 Someone forgot Henley can fly. 144 00:06:30,457 --> 00:06:32,260 (AUDIENCE CHEERING) 145 00:06:43,037 --> 00:06:45,472 We can take it from here, but a round of applause 146 00:06:45,539 --> 00:06:47,341 for the best Horseman on stage. 147 00:06:47,407 --> 00:06:49,977 Whoo! Wow. 148 00:06:50,044 --> 00:06:51,444 BRETT: Hey, hey, hey. Hey, hey. 149 00:06:51,512 --> 00:06:54,348 Fantastic. So, everybody, I want you to take your drink, 150 00:06:54,414 --> 00:06:57,318 and I want you to pour it onto the face of your card. 151 00:06:57,385 --> 00:06:59,687 Can you do that? 152 00:06:59,754 --> 00:07:02,422 JACK: Those 12 unique words on each of your cards 153 00:07:02,489 --> 00:07:05,458 -form the password to your new crypto wallet. -MAN IN AUDIENCE: Oh! 154 00:07:05,526 --> 00:07:09,030 Log on and you'll find Brett's stolen millions more... 155 00:07:09,096 --> 00:07:10,463 fairly redistributed. 156 00:07:10,531 --> 00:07:13,935 Oh, my God. Fifty... 50,000 bucks! 157 00:07:14,001 --> 00:07:15,369 50,000! 158 00:07:15,435 --> 00:07:17,405 (AUDIENCE CHEERING LOUDLY) 159 00:07:18,539 --> 00:07:20,207 You're freaking done, dude! 160 00:07:20,274 --> 00:07:23,044 Whoa, whoa! Cool your head, gingerbread, 161 00:07:23,110 --> 00:07:24,879 because I am having a vision. 162 00:07:24,946 --> 00:07:28,950 Eh, maybe cops are gonna come bursting through that door! 163 00:07:29,016 --> 00:07:30,685 So perform a magic trick of your own 164 00:07:30,751 --> 00:07:34,555 and disappear in three, two, one. 165 00:07:35,289 --> 00:07:37,158 (AUDIENCE CLAMORING) 166 00:07:37,224 --> 00:07:39,459 (SIREN WAILING) 167 00:07:49,103 --> 00:07:53,007 ATLAS: (ON RECORDING) Now come in close. Mm, closer. 168 00:07:53,074 --> 00:07:55,710 Because the more you think you see, the easier it will be 169 00:07:55,776 --> 00:07:57,011 -to dress up old tricks... -What? 170 00:07:57,078 --> 00:07:58,579 ...and fool you that they are new. 171 00:07:58,646 --> 00:08:00,414 (GASPS) 172 00:08:00,480 --> 00:08:01,749 Oh, my God, no. 173 00:08:02,283 --> 00:08:03,517 No! 174 00:08:03,584 --> 00:08:05,419 (SOBBING) No! 175 00:08:05,987 --> 00:08:07,188 (HITS SHEET) 176 00:08:07,254 --> 00:08:09,090 (DRAMATIC MUSIC PLAYING) 177 00:08:19,233 --> 00:08:21,035 (SIREN WAILING) 178 00:08:21,102 --> 00:08:24,171 Look, in my opinion, I think you did a great job. 179 00:08:24,238 --> 00:08:26,007 Uh, I think my Atlas was good. 180 00:08:26,073 --> 00:08:27,341 My Merritt could probably use some work. 181 00:08:27,408 --> 00:08:29,543 -JUNE: Mm. -It's like a San Diego stoner 182 00:08:29,610 --> 00:08:31,245 and a shrimp boat captain had a baby. 183 00:08:31,312 --> 00:08:32,747 -Sure. -(CHUCKLING) 184 00:08:32,813 --> 00:08:34,749 JUNE: No, seriously, Bosco, I don't know how you do it. 185 00:08:34,815 --> 00:08:36,951 A good impersonation isn't just about the mimicry. 186 00:08:37,018 --> 00:08:38,986 It's about attention to detail, 187 00:08:39,053 --> 00:08:40,554 personality and nuance. 188 00:08:40,621 --> 00:08:42,223 Okay. Okay. Let me try, let me try. 189 00:08:42,289 --> 00:08:44,759 Um... (HIGH-PITCHED) I'm J. Daniel Atlas. 190 00:08:44,825 --> 00:08:47,762 (SPUTTERS) The closer you look, the less you see. 191 00:08:47,828 --> 00:08:48,863 CHARLIE: (LAUGHS) It was something. 192 00:08:48,929 --> 00:08:50,364 Yep. Uh, you'll work on it. 193 00:08:50,431 --> 00:08:51,532 -I wasn't bad. -It was a good start. 194 00:08:51,599 --> 00:08:53,401 -But it could use some work. -Okay, sure. 195 00:08:53,467 --> 00:08:55,202 -What do you keep looking at? -Nothing, nothing, nothing. 196 00:08:55,269 --> 00:08:58,139 Dude, cheer up. Guys, come on! Look at us! 197 00:08:58,205 --> 00:09:01,609 Look at how far we've come. We totally scored tonight. 198 00:09:01,675 --> 00:09:03,544 JUNE: All right, next time, you wear the pink wig, okay? 199 00:09:03,611 --> 00:09:05,279 BOSCO: No. 200 00:09:05,346 --> 00:09:07,882 -Dude, it's locked again. -Okay, I'll pick it. 201 00:09:07,948 --> 00:09:09,550 Wait, wait, wait, hold on. Do the thing. 202 00:09:09,617 --> 00:09:10,718 -No. -Please do the thing. 203 00:09:10,785 --> 00:09:11,952 -It's so unnecessary. -It's so cool. 204 00:09:12,019 --> 00:09:13,320 -I'll hold your bag. -It's so unnecessary. 205 00:09:13,387 --> 00:09:14,922 -Come on, it's fun. -Okay. 206 00:09:17,024 --> 00:09:18,325 (SUSPENSEFUL MUSIC PLAYING) 207 00:09:22,329 --> 00:09:23,597 BOSCO: You got this. 208 00:09:25,699 --> 00:09:27,502 (GRUNTS) 209 00:09:27,568 --> 00:09:30,071 -She's like a little Mario. -She is like Mario. 210 00:09:30,137 --> 00:09:31,939 CHARLIE: Careful, careful. BOSCO: Please don't die. 211 00:09:32,006 --> 00:09:33,542 BOSCO: Are you okay? JUNE: Yeah. 212 00:09:36,511 --> 00:09:38,412 BOSCO: If I could do that, I would only do that. 213 00:09:38,479 --> 00:09:40,448 -(CHUCKLES) It's so cool. -It's insane. 214 00:09:40,515 --> 00:09:41,516 Happy? 215 00:09:41,582 --> 00:09:42,817 -Yeah, that was awesome. -Yeah. 216 00:09:42,883 --> 00:09:44,985 Please let us in. It's cold. 217 00:09:45,052 --> 00:09:46,821 -JUNE: Whoo. -(GATE RATTLING) 218 00:09:46,887 --> 00:09:48,689 Best apartment in the whole city. 219 00:09:48,756 --> 00:09:51,125 Yep, and no one will ever see it but us. 220 00:09:51,192 --> 00:09:52,393 (JUNE CHUCKLES) 221 00:09:52,460 --> 00:09:54,395 (CRUSADES BY GEESE PLAYING FAINTLY) 222 00:09:54,462 --> 00:09:55,796 ♪ Everybody... ♪ 223 00:09:55,863 --> 00:09:57,064 It's such a shame. 224 00:09:58,499 --> 00:10:01,469 ♪ But in my armor I am a man... ♪ 225 00:10:01,536 --> 00:10:02,736 ATLAS: (ON RECORDING) Come in close. 226 00:10:03,370 --> 00:10:04,371 Closer. 227 00:10:04,438 --> 00:10:07,842 JUNE: That guy is so screwed. 228 00:10:07,908 --> 00:10:09,443 (RECORDING CONTINUES PLAYING INDISTINCTLY) 229 00:10:09,511 --> 00:10:11,112 Who's rich now? 230 00:10:11,178 --> 00:10:13,147 Charlie, can you turn that thing off, please? 231 00:10:13,214 --> 00:10:14,615 I think I've had enough Atlas for one night. 232 00:10:14,682 --> 00:10:15,683 CHARLIE: Yeah, I got you. 233 00:10:15,749 --> 00:10:17,384 ATLAS: ...disappears, reappears. 234 00:10:17,451 --> 00:10:19,887 At least if the trick is done right. 235 00:10:19,954 --> 00:10:22,156 Bosco, can you check for pizza? I'm so hungry. 236 00:10:22,223 --> 00:10:23,357 BOSCO: Ugh, me, too. 237 00:10:23,424 --> 00:10:24,325 ATLAS: (ON RECORDING) ...Four Horsemen! 238 00:10:24,391 --> 00:10:26,727 BOSCO: No pizza, but we got beer. 239 00:10:26,794 --> 00:10:28,662 -And, no, literally just beer. -Closer. Because 240 00:10:28,729 --> 00:10:30,164 -the more you think you see... -BOSCO: Any takers? 241 00:10:30,231 --> 00:10:32,166 -Yeah, I'll have one. -(INTRIGUING MUSIC PLAYING) 242 00:10:32,233 --> 00:10:33,568 Dude, seriously, turn that thing off. 243 00:10:33,634 --> 00:10:35,302 I did. 244 00:10:35,369 --> 00:10:38,305 Okay. Real funny, guys. Where's the other projector? 245 00:10:38,372 --> 00:10:39,373 I'm not a hologram. 246 00:10:39,440 --> 00:10:41,375 "I'm not a hologram." Right. Yes. 247 00:10:41,442 --> 00:10:43,277 Exactly what a hologram would say. 248 00:10:44,745 --> 00:10:46,647 -Oh, my God, you're real. -Never touch my face again. 249 00:10:46,714 --> 00:10:48,149 I'm so sorry. I thought that you were a hologram. 250 00:10:48,215 --> 00:10:49,984 I would never do that. I'm a huge fan of yours. 251 00:10:50,050 --> 00:10:51,252 How are you? (PANTING) 252 00:10:51,318 --> 00:10:53,654 How did you find us? 253 00:10:53,721 --> 00:10:55,422 I don't know. Took me about 30 seconds. 254 00:10:55,489 --> 00:10:56,924 And if it was this easy for me to find you, 255 00:10:56,991 --> 00:10:58,692 how hard would it be for the police? 256 00:10:58,759 --> 00:11:00,995 -Whoa, hold on, the police? -ATLAS: Yeah, the police. 257 00:11:01,061 --> 00:11:02,930 Why would the police be looking for us? 258 00:11:02,997 --> 00:11:04,031 Uh, I don't know, what about that 259 00:11:04,098 --> 00:11:05,399 little heist you just pulled? 260 00:11:05,466 --> 00:11:07,868 Or the fact that you're squatting in this place 261 00:11:07,935 --> 00:11:09,003 or that your electricity comes from 262 00:11:09,069 --> 00:11:10,505 the circuit box in the corner? 263 00:11:10,572 --> 00:11:12,673 I don't know, it could be anything. Am I right, Bozo? 264 00:11:12,740 --> 00:11:14,175 (CHUCKLES) Bosco. 265 00:11:14,241 --> 00:11:15,544 -ATLAS: Hmm. -Bosco Leroy. 266 00:11:15,610 --> 00:11:17,945 Ah, that's right, yeah, Bosco Leroy. 267 00:11:18,012 --> 00:11:21,182 What, did you type, uh, "fictional magician name" into ChatGPT? 268 00:11:21,248 --> 00:11:23,751 -No, that's actually my real name, Atlas. -ATLAS: Hmm. 269 00:11:23,817 --> 00:11:25,286 What, did your mom have sex with a map? 270 00:11:25,352 --> 00:11:26,521 (JUNE AND CHARLIE LAUGH) 271 00:11:27,454 --> 00:11:29,558 -That's not funny. -ATLAS: Hmm. 272 00:11:29,624 --> 00:11:30,858 You don't know anything about us, dude. 273 00:11:30,925 --> 00:11:32,527 -I know everything about you. -Oh. 274 00:11:32,594 --> 00:11:35,196 The dubiously named Bosco Leroy, 275 00:11:35,262 --> 00:11:36,697 a promising acting career 276 00:11:36,764 --> 00:11:38,732 cut short by crippling student loans. 277 00:11:38,799 --> 00:11:40,301 It's a bummer you had to drop out of Juilliard, 278 00:11:40,367 --> 00:11:43,037 but you never stopped performing. 279 00:11:43,103 --> 00:11:45,072 Uh, if memory serves, your last paid gig, 280 00:11:45,139 --> 00:11:47,141 I think, was dressing as Elmo in Times Square?
